channel.title: Homes on Biosystems Analytics Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Biosystems Analytics Lab

item.description: Principal Investigator Natalie Nelson is an Assistant Professor of Data Analytics and Integrated Modeling in the Biological & Agricultural Engineering Department at North Carolina State University. She leads the Biosystems Analytics Lab, studies from which take a data-intensive, management-focused, and interdisciplinary approach to the study of complex biological system dynamics. Dr. Nelson is particularly interested in questions related to estuarine and coastal water quality, land-sea connectivity, and the influence of global and local change on agroecosystem productivity in the Atlantic-Gulf Coastal Plains.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Asterisks indicate an author is/was a graduate (*) or undergraduate (**) researcher in the Biosystems Analytics Lab Peer-reviewed: NG Nelson, L Montefiore*, C Anthony**, L Merriman, E Kuster, GA Fox, 2019, Undergraduate exposure to climate education in natural resources management, Transactions of the ASABE, 62(3): 831-839. L Smith, CN Jones, NG Nelson, 2019, Featured Collection Introduction: The Emerging Science of Aquatic System Connectivity II, Journal of the American Water Resources Association, 55(3): 526-528

item.title: Teaching and Training
item.description: Research and Extension Experience for Undergraduates: Pigs, Poultry, the Planet, and Data-Driven Problem Solving (“P4”). Funding available for undergraduate fellowships each summer, 2019 - 2023. Courses: BAE 495 / 590: R Coding for Data Management and Analysis (fall 2019, distance ed) BAE 590: Environmental and Agricultural Data Analytics and Modeling (offered every spring) BAE 495 / 590: Applied Statistics for Environmental and Agricultural Data Analysis (spring 2018) Guest lectures:
